paper_abstract: Improving tire overall performance of reliable speech communication in ultrashort wave radios over very noisy channels is of great importance and practical use. Air iterative Joint source-channel (de-)coding and (de-)modulation (JSCCM) algorithm is proposed for ITU-T Rec.G.729EV by both exploiting the residual redundancy and passing soft information throughout tire receiver while introducing a systematic global iteration process. Being fully compatible with existing transmitter structure, the proposed algorithm does riot introduce additional bandwidth expansion and transmission delay, Simulations show substantial error correcting performance and synthesized speech quality improvement over conventional separate designed systems in delay and bandwidth constraint channels by using the JSCCM algorithm.
paper_title: An Iterative Joint Source-Channel (De-)Coding and (De-)Modulation Algorithm for G.729EV in Ultrashort Wave Communication
